Instruction: Combine flour, 1 cup along with 3 tablespoons of butter, and nutmeg in a large bowl until thoroughly blended. Incorporate 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons of milk until the dough forms.
On a surface dusted with flour, roll the dough until it's 1/4-inch thick and slice into small sections.
Warm oil in a deep-fryer or large pot to 350 degrees F. In separate portions, fry the pieces of dough until golden brown and they rise to the top, approximately 3 to 5 minutes.

The nutritional content of the oil used for frying has been estimated based on a retention value of 10% post-cooking. The exact amount may differ based on the duration and temperature of cooking, the density of the ingredient, and the specific type of oil used.
